B149.1-15 Code Review for: Clause 5:  Pressure Controls
Instructions: Referencing the CSA B149.1-10 Code, answer the following questions
The minimum clearance specified in which clauses between a pressure regulator and the
moisture-exhaust duct shall be maintained?
Clauses 7.4.4 and 7.5.2 – Clause 5.2.1.2
Every regulator shall be certified and be of sufficient size to provide what at the extremes of inlet pressures to which the regulator can be exposed?
The required flow of gas – Clause 5.2.1.1
A line pressure regulator shall have which type of valve installed upstream of the regulator?
A manual shut-off valve – Clause 5.2.1.5
Is it acceptable to bypass a pressure regulator?
NO - A pressure regulator shall not be bypassed. - Clause - 5.2.1.3
When a line pressure regulator is required and the inlet supply pressure to the regulator exceeds
0.5 psig (3.5 kPa), it shall be of which type of regulator?
The positive shut-off type – Clause 5.2.1.4
A line pressure regulator shall have either a line relief device or what other type of device?. The regulator vent and relief device vent shall terminate outdoors.
An overpressure protection device  – Clause 5.2.1.5
A pressure regulator provided in a gas supply line shall not be installed where?
(a) where it is inaccessible for repair, replacement, servicing, or inspection;
(b) in a concealed location; or
(c) where it could be reasonably expected to be subject to physical or chemical damage. - Clause 5.2.1.6
In regards to additional requirements for pressure regulators for natural gas applications:
When used on a system operating at 2 psig (14 kPa) or less, a line pressure regulator equipped with a
leak limiting system orificed for what quantity of a gas having a specific gravity of 0.6 shall be exempt from the requirement of Clause 5.2.1.5(b).
2.5 ft3/h (0.0706 m3/h – Clause 5.2.3.1
For systems with inlet pressures above 2 psig (14 kPa), a pressure regulator shall be exempt from
compliance with Clause 5.2.1.5(b) of this Code, provided that it is equipped to limit the escape
of gas from the vent openings, even in the event of what type of failure, to less than 2.5 f3/h
(0.0706 m3/h), that it has an overpressure protection device set to a pressure either below 2 psig
(14 kPa) or 2 times the delivery pressure on the system, and that it is certified to ANSI Z21.80/CSA 6.22.
A main diaphragm failure - Clause 5.2.3.2
In regards to additional requirements for pressure regulators for propane applications
How shall a regulator be secured to the container valve, or the regulator bracket on the wall or hood?
A regulator shall be firmly secured.  Clause 5.2.2.1
.When installed outdoors and subject to inclement weather, the regulator shall be protected as necessary from exposure to what??
The regulator shall be protected as necessary from exposure to weather conditions – Clause 5.2.2.1
A regulator installed outdoors or in an unheated area shall be positioned so that the bonnet vent opening discharges in what position?, except that  (a) when installed within a container dome, the vent opening shall be positioned downward not less than 15° from the horizontal; and (b) a single-stage regulator of a capacity not exceeding 150 000 Btuh (45 kW) may be installed in a horizontal position, provided that it is protected from inclement weather.
Vertically downward  - Clause 5.2.2.3
It is correct to say that not less than one-stage regulation shall be utilized on all permanent propane installations?
No that is incorrect - Not less than two-stage regulation shall be utilized on all permanent propane installations.  – Clause 5.2.2.2
When used on a system operating at 2 psig (14 kPa) or less, a line pressure regulator equipped with a
leak limiting system orificed for what quantity of a gas having a specific gravity of 1.53 shall be exempt from the requirement of Clause 5.2.1.5(b)?
1 ft3/h (0.0283 m3/h) - Clause 5.2.2.4
A regulator with vent limiting means shall be installed in what type of space only.
A ventilated Space - Clause 5.2.2.4
In regards to Relief devices:
Except as specified in Clauses 5.2.2.4 and 5.2.3, when a line pressure regulator is not equipped with an internal relief device, it shall have immediately downstream what type of  protection device or a line relief device as required in Clause 5.2.1.5(b), with a discharge setting of either (a) not less than 2 times and not more than 3 times the delivery pressure on systems operating up to 5 psig (35 kPa); or (b) not less than 1.5 times and not more than 2 times the delivery pressure on systems operating at more than 5 psig (35 kPa)?  The relieving pressure setting of the line relief device shall be not higher than that of the lowest-rated component or accessory located downstream.
An overpressure protection device – Clause 5.3
In regards to hydrostatic relief devices for propane applications:
Discharge lines from two or more hydrostatic relief devices may run into a common discharge header, provided that the cross-sectional area of the header is at least equal to what and that the header is not connected to any vent or bleed line?
The sum of the cross-sectional areas of the individual discharge lines-  Clause 5.4.2
A hydrostatic relief device (to relieve at a safe location outdoors) shall be installed between each pair of shut-off valves on what type of propane piping system?. The start-to-discharge pressure setting of such a hydrostatic relief device shall be neither less than 375 psig (2500 kPa) nor more than 500 psig (3500 kPa).
Propane liquid piping - Clause 5.4.1
In regards to venting of pressure control devices:
Except as specified in Clauses 5.5.2, 5.5.3, and 5.6.2 for natural gas and Clauses 5.5.3, 5.5.10, and 5.6.1.3 for propane, when an automatic valve, diaphragm valve, combination control, pressure regulator without internal relief, or other control device (excluding a gas overpressure relief valve) that requires venting is installed, it shall be vented separately to a safe location outdoors by what type of vent line that complies with Clause 6.2?  and of a size at least equal to the nominal pipe size of the vent outlet of the valve, combination control, pressure regulator, or control device, but in no case shall the inside diameter be less than 0.25 in (6 mm).
A vent line of steel pipe, copper, seamless aluminum, or steel tubing -  Clause 5.5.1
When two or more, or any combination of, automatic valves, diaphragm valves, combination controls, other control devices (excluding gas overpressure relief valves), or pressure regulators without internal relief that require venting are installed, they may be connected into a single vent, provided that (a) there is compliance with (i) Clause 5.5.1(a) and (b) for inlet pressure not in excess of 0.5 psig (3.5 kPa); or (ii) Clause 5.5.4(a) and (b) for inlet pressure in excess of 0.5 psig (3.5 kPa); and (b) the single vent line has an area of not less than what?
Twice the total area of the connected bleed vents - Clause 5.5.3
When two or more gas overpressure relief valves are installed, they may be connected into a single vent line, provided that (a) there is compliance with Clause 5.5.4; (b) the single vent line has an area equal to what? (c) the variance between the inlet pressures of the overpressure relief valves does not exceed 10%; and (d) the variance between the inlet pressures and the variance between the outlet pressures of the relief valves does not exceed 10%.
The largest relief valve opening plus 50% of the total area of the other relief valve openings - Clause 5.5.5
For propane applications, a regulator vent, line relief device, or hydrostatic relief device discharging vertically upward shall be provided with what? When discharging downward, it shall be provided with a protective screen.
A loose-fitting rain cap Clause 5.5.11
Except as specified in Clause 5.5.5, when a pressure regulator with internal relief or a gas overpressure relief valve is installed, it shall be vented separately to a safe location outdoors by a vent line (a) of steel pipe, or of seamless steel tubing or copper tubing that complies with Clause 6.2; and (b) of a size (i) at least equal to the nominal pipe size of the vent outlet of the valve or regulator increased as specified by the manufacturer’s instructions; or (ii) in the absence of manufacturer’s instructions, increased by one pipe size diameter for every 50 ft (15 m) or part thereof that the vent line extends beyond the initial 50 ft (15 m). This increase shall be made where?
At the connection on the device - Clause 5.5.4
A safety limit or a safety relief device shall not be isolated, bypassed, or in any way made ineffective by what?
A valve or other device.  - Clause 5.5.8
The discharge from relief devices shall terminate outdoors with the clearances specified in which table?
Table 5.2. - Clause 5.5.9
For natural gas applications, when a diaphragm valve or combination control is installed on an appliance with an inlet supply pressure not in excess of 0.5 psig (3.5 kPa) and using a gas lighter than air, it may be vented into where - adjacent to the continuous pilot provided that the terminus of the bleed vent is in a burner tip having a melting point in excess of 1450°F (790 °C) that is securely held in a fixed position relative to the pilot flame and that will not adversely affect the operation of the thermal element?
The appliance combustion chamber - Clause 5.5.2
The outdoor vent termination of regulators and line relief devices shall be equipped with a means to prevent the entry of what?
Water, insects, or foreign material.- Clause 5.5.6
A vent line shall be of sufficient size and configuration to prevent impedance upon what?
A regulator.-  Clause 5.5.7
For propane applications, except as specified in Clause 5.6.1.3, a pressure regulator, line relief device, or hydrostatic relief device on an appliance using gas heavier than air shall be equipped with a vent line (a) in accordance with Clause 5.5.4(a) and (b); and (b) terminati

B149.1-15 Code Review for: Clause 5:  Pressure Controls
Instructions: Referencing the CSA B149.1-10 Code, answer the following questions
The minimum clearance specified in which clauses between a pressure regulator and the
moisture-exhaust duct shall be maintained?
Clauses 7.4.4 and 7.5.2 – Clause 5.2.1.2
Every regulator shall be certified and be of sufficient size to provide what at the extremes of inlet pressures to which the regulator can be exposed?
The required flow of gas – Clause 5.2.1.1
A line pressure regulator shall have which type of valve installed upstream of the regulator?
A manual shut-off valve – Clause 5.2.1.5
Is it acceptable to bypass a pressure regulator?
NO - A pressure regulator shall not be bypassed. - Clause - 5.2.1.3
When a line pressure regulator is required and the inlet supply pressure to the regulator exceeds
0.5 psig (3.5 kPa), it shall be of which type of regulator?
The positive shut-off type – Clause 5.2.1.4
A line pressure regulator shall have either a line relief device or what other type of device?. The regulator vent and relief device vent shall terminate outdoors.
An overpressure protection device  – Clause 5.2.1.5
A pressure regulator provided in a gas supply line shall not be installed where?
(a) where it is inaccessible for repair, replacement, servicing, or inspection;
(b) in a concealed location; or
(c) where it could be reasonably expected to be subject to physical or chemical damage. - Clause 5.2.1.6
In regards to additional requirements for pressure regulators for natural gas applications:
When used on a system operating at 2 psig (14 kPa) or less, a line pressure regulator equipped with a
leak limiting system orificed for what quantity of a gas having a specific gravity of 0.6 shall be exempt from the requirement of Clause 5.2.1.5(b).
2.5 ft3/h (0.0706 m3/h – Clause 5.2.3.1
For systems with inlet pressures above 2 psig (14 kPa), a pressure regulator shall be exempt from
compliance with Clause 5.2.1.5(b) of this Code, provided that it is equipped to limit the escape
of gas from the vent openings, even in the event of what type of failure, to less than 2.5 f3/h
(0.0706 m3/h), that it has an overpressure protection device set to a pressure either below 2 psig
(14 kPa) or 2 times the delivery pressure on the system, and that it is certified to ANSI Z21.80/CSA 6.22.
A main diaphragm failure - Clause 5.2.3.2
In regards to additional requirements for pressure regulators for propane applications
How shall a regulator be secured to the container valve, or the regulator bracket on the wall or hood?
A regulator shall be firmly secured.  Clause 5.2.2.1
.When installed outdoors and subject to inclement weather, the regulator shall be protected as necessary from exposure to what??
The regulator shall be protected as necessary from exposure to weather conditions – Clause 5.2.2.1
A regulator installed outdoors or in an unheated area shall be positioned so that the bonnet vent opening discharges in what position?, except that  (a) when installed within a container dome, the vent opening shall be positioned downward not less than 15° from the horizontal; and (b) a single-stage regulator of a capacity not exceeding 150 000 Btuh (45 kW) may be installed in a horizontal position, provided that it is protected from inclement weather.
Vertically downward  - Clause 5.2.2.3
It is correct to say that not less than one-stage regulation shall be utilized on all permanent propane installations?
No that is incorrect - Not less than two-stage regulation shall be utilized on all permanent propane installations.  – Clause 5.2.2.2
When used on a system operating at 2 psig (14 kPa) or less, a line pressure regulator equipped with a
leak limiting system orificed for what quantity of a gas having a specific gravity of 1.53 shall be exempt from the requirement of Clause 5.2.1.5(b)?
1 ft3/h (0.0283 m3/h) - Clause 5.2.2.4
A regulator with vent limiting means shall be installed in what type of space only.
A ventilated Space - Clause 5.2.2.4
In regards to Relief devices:
Except as specified in Clauses 5.2.2.4 and 5.2.3, when a line pressure regulator is not equipped with an internal relief device, it shall have immediately downstream what type of  protection device or a line relief device as required in Clause 5.2.1.5(b), with a discharge setting of either (a) not less than 2 times and not more than 3 times the delivery pressure on systems operating up to 5 psig (35 kPa); or (b) not less than 1.5 times and not more than 2 times the delivery pressure on systems operating at more than 5 psig (35 kPa)?  The relieving pressure setting of the line relief device shall be not higher than that of the lowest-rated component or accessory located downstream.
An overpressure protection device – Clause 5.3
In regards to hydrostatic relief devices for propane applications:
Discharge lines from two or more hydrostatic relief devices may run into a common discharge header, provided that the cross-sectional area of the header is at least equal to what and that the header is not connected to any vent or bleed line?
The sum of the cross-sectional areas of the individual discharge lines-  Clause 5.4.2
A hydrostatic relief device (to relieve at a safe location outdoors) shall be installed between each pair of shut-off valves on what type of propane piping system?. The start-to-discharge pressure setting of such a hydrostatic relief device shall be neither less than 375 psig (2500 kPa) nor more than 500 psig (3500 kPa).
Propane liquid piping - Clause 5.4.1
In regards to venting of pressure control devices:
Except as specified in Clauses 5.5.2, 5.5.3, and 5.6.2 for natural gas and Clauses 5.5.3, 5.5.10, and 5.6.1.3 for propane, when an automatic valve, diaphragm valve, combination control, pressure regulator without internal relief, or other control device (excluding a gas overpressure relief valve) that requires venting is installed, it shall be vented separately to a safe location outdoors by what type of vent line that complies with Clause 6.2?  and of a size at least equal to the nominal pipe size of the vent outlet of the valve, combination control, pressure regulator, or control device, but in no case shall the inside diameter be less than 0.25 in (6 mm).
A vent line of steel pipe, copper, seamless aluminum, or steel tubing -  Clause 5.5.1
When two or more, or any combination of, automatic valves, diaphragm valves, combination controls, other control devices (excluding gas overpressure relief valves), or pressure regulators without internal relief that require venting are installed, they may be connected into a single vent, provided that (a) there is compliance with (i) Clause 5.5.1(a) and (b) for inlet pressure not in excess of 0.5 psig (3.5 kPa); or (ii) Clause 5.5.4(a) and (b) for inlet pressure in excess of 0.5 psig (3.5 kPa); and (b) the single vent line has an area of not less than what?
Twice the total area of the connected bleed vents - Clause 5.5.3
When two or more gas overpressure relief valves are installed, they may be connected into a single vent line, provided that (a) there is compliance with Clause 5.5.4; (b) the single vent line has an area equal to what? (c) the variance between the inlet pressures of the overpressure relief valves does not exceed 10%; and (d) the variance between the inlet pressures and the variance between the outlet pressures of the relief valves does not exceed 10%.
The largest relief valve opening plus 50% of the total area of the other relief valve openings - Clause 5.5.5
For propane applications, a regulator vent, line relief device, or hydrostatic relief device discharging vertically upward shall be provided with what? When discharging downward, it shall be provided with a protective screen.
A loose-fitting rain cap Clause 5.5.11
Except as specified in Clause 5.5.5, when a pressure regulator with internal relief or a gas overpressure relief valve is installed, it shall be vented separately to a safe location outdoors by a vent line (a) of steel pipe, or of seamless steel tubing or copper tubing that complies with Clause 6.2; and (b) of a size (i) at least equal to the nominal pipe size of the vent outlet of the valve or regulator increased as specified by the manufacturer’s instructions; or (ii) in the absence of manufacturer’s instructions, increased by one pipe size diameter for every 50 ft (15 m) or part thereof that the vent line extends beyond the initial 50 ft (15 m). This increase shall be made where?
At the connection on the device - Clause 5.5.4
A safety limit or a safety relief device shall not be isolated, bypassed, or in any way made ineffective by what?
A valve or other device.  - Clause 5.5.8
The discharge from relief devices shall terminate outdoors with the clearances specified in which table?
Table 5.2. - Clause 5.5.9
For natural gas applications, when a diaphragm valve or combination control is installed on an appliance with an inlet supply pressure not in excess of 0.5 psig (3.5 kPa) and using a gas lighter than air, it may be vented into where - adjacent to the continuous pilot provided that the terminus of the bleed vent is in a burner tip having a melting point in excess of 1450°F (790 °C) that is securely held in a fixed position relative to the pilot flame and that will not adversely affect the operation of the thermal element?
The appliance combustion chamber - Clause 5.5.2
The outdoor vent termination of regulators and line relief devices shall be equipped with a means to prevent the entry of what?
Water, insects, or foreign material.- Clause 5.5.6
A vent line shall be of sufficient size and configuration to prevent impedance upon what?
A regulator.-  Clause 5.5.7
For propane applications, except as specified in Clause 5.6.1.3, a pressure regulator, line relief device, or hydrostatic relief device on an appliance using gas heavier than air shall be equipped with a vent line (a) in accordance with Clause 5.5.4(a) and (b); and (b) terminati
